# Generic formula for hddivsteps

Here we derive and give a proof sketch for a generic formula for the number of iterations required for hddivsteps.

## Formula

Let:
* *D = 273548757304312537*
* *&alpha; = ((1591853137+ 3 &radic;D)/2<sup>55</sup>)<sup>1/54</sup>*
* *c = ((-19751135418668288368216383463280589685 &radic;D + 10349650559956097752413992821516710718899029335) &alpha;<sup>44</sup> + (-149208097289600249806643527680 &radic;D + 300401370399750633778348248661638512640) &alpha;<sup>5</sup>) / 76233287546799168829891154710263496704*

**Theorem 1** If *0 &leq; g &leq; f &leq; M* and *&alpha;<sup>n</sup>cM < 1*, then *n* is a sufficient number of hddivsteps for inputs *(f,g)*.

This translates to approximately *n &geq; &lceil; 2.30352752220748859 log<sub>2</sub>(M) + 0.32038697170940896 &rceil;*.

## Proof sketch

**Definition 1** Define the function *hull*, which maps a list of points in the *(f,g)* space to the set of all points inside or on the edge of the convex hull
whose vertices are the inputs to the function.

**Definition 2** Define the function *h*, which maps every *&delta;* which is an integer plus *1/2* to a set of points, as follows. The constants *H<sub>1/2</sub>* and *H<sub>-1/2</sub>* are defined in the appendix below.
* If *&delta; = -1/2*: *h(&delta;) = hull(H<sub>-1/2)</sub>*
* If *&delta; < -1*: *h(&delta;) = hull([[0, 2<sup>&delta; - 1/2</sup>],[-1/2, 2<sup>&delta; - 3/2</sup>]]&alpha;<sup>&delta; - 3/2</sup>H<sub>1/2</sub>)*
* If *&delta; > 0*: *h(&delta;) = hull([[1, 0], [0, 2<sup>1/2 - &delta;</sup>]]&alpha;<sup>1/2 - &delta;</sup>H<sub>1/2</sub>)*

**Theorem 2** The collection of hulls defined by *h(&delta;)* has the property of being mapped to a *&alpha;*-scaled version of itself by hddivsteps. Specifically:
* (a) If *(f,g) &isin; h(&delta;)* then *(f,g/2) &isin; &alpha;h(1+&delta;)*
* (b) If *(f,g) &isin; h(&delta;) and &delta; < 0* then *(f,(g+f)/2) &isin; &alpha;h(1+&delta;)*
* (c) If *(f,g) &isin; h(&delta;) and &delta; > 0* then *(g,(g-f)/2) &isin; &alpha;h(1-&delta;)*

**Corollary** This means that if *(f,g) &isin; qh(&delta;)* for some scale factor *q*, the result of performing *k* hddivsteps
on it will be in *&alpha;<sup>k</sup>qh(&delta;')* for some *&delta;'*.

### Fitting the (0,0),(0,M),(M,M) triangle

Intersecting the *H<sub>1/2</sub>* hull with the *f=g* line, we find *f = g = ((-19751135418668288368216383463280589685 &radic;D + 10349650559956097752413992821516710718899029335)*&alpha;^43 + (-149208097289600249806643527680*&radic;D + 300401370399750633778348248661638512640)*&alpha;^4


## Appendix: H<sub>1/2</sub> and H<sub>-1/2</sub>

* `s` means *&radic;D*
* `r` means *1/&alpha;*.
